Brazil has one of the largest economies in Latin America. Its economic growth has been heavily influenced by agricultural exports, industrialization, and fluctuations in global commodity prices.


Environmental challenges in Brazil include deforestation in the Amazon rainforest, urban pollution, and biodiversity loss. The government has implemented various policies to address these issues, such as the Forest Code and initiatives to promote sustainable agriculture.
